duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee and manage J-SOX audits for the company and its affiliates, including compliance audits for all in-scope business processes.
Identify risk areas and propose changes to existing systems of internal control to meet regulatory compliance standards.
Recommend policy changes and implementation procedures to ensure best practices in internal controls.
Assist with the co-ordination of the J-SOX audit compliance program with outside examiners and auditors.
Conduct corporate audits, including on-site audits according to Internal Aisin Standards covering various areas.
Communicate day-to-day activities with senior management in NA/Japan and assist with the identification, development, implementation, and analysis of internal controls.
Perform special projects, ATSG audits, and other duties as assigned.
Support all IT compliance related activities and monitor the remediation status of deficient internal controls.
Keep up to date with the changing audit guidance provided by the Japanese Financial Services Agency (FSA).
Assist with the design and implementation of detailed business process plans, and monitor implementation progress for proposed action plans and control gaps.
Assist with the identification, development, implementation, and analysis of internal controls, and propose action plans for control gaps.
Examine existing documentation and assist with the implementation of changes to meet process requirements and ensure compliance.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related major
